wikipedia_page.main: Oliver Dolan (c. 1894 – 19 March 1985) was an English professional rugby league footballer who played in the 1920s and 1930s. He played at representative level for Great Britain (non-Test matches), and England, and at club level for St Helens Recs, as a hooker, i.e. number 9, during the era of contested scrums.

link_mentions.page: List of Great Britain national rugby league team players

response: * Oliver Dolan won caps for England while at St. Helens Recs (1932, Wales)
